Yes. I don't for Altoshipping, I just find M05 and the AG ones really interesting for both their historic importance in being the last cel films and also for the context surrounding themselves.

Pokemon was beginning to be really commercialized and corporate during gen 3 but it still didn't sink in so you still get movie exclusive stuff that conflicts with the game and really interesting plots. Or how these movies ended up influencing the manga and even games.

>>52744531
>This movie was the first to be outsourced to a different studio, though OLM still did some work on it.
>While the wikipedia page says this was all digitally inked, only the sight sharing scenes and parts of the credits are digitally inked.
>They hired accordionist COBA to do the soundtrack
>Japanese fansites misreported that Annie and Oakley were TR members and that Latias joined Ash in AG
>When this movie was released in theatres, after the credits, there was a few seconds of silence followed by a slide that said translated NEXT YEAR 2003 ADVANCE GENERATION followed by pic related. This was the first time people found out Misty was leaving
>The Japanese wiki page says this and Jirachi were submitted for best animated feature. The wiki also says this movie was regarded as a "instant masterpiece" amongst Pokemon movies
>Apparently Altomare is near Whirl Islands in a map released in 2010 but chronologically, this movie has to take place between Politoed's evolution and Ash reuniting with Lapras
>The Lucario movie entered pre-production the same time the Jirachi movie did in late 2002.

posts.com:
>>52748742
Ash and Co are in Johto, somewhere by the coast, when Ash spots a torrent of water in the distance. In an instant, he's tackled by Latias, who felt his presence from Alto Mare and came rushing over. After a little bit of time catching up with plenty of flashbacks to reanimated sequences from the movie, we get into some minor action/adventure where Latias helps save the day, perhaps bringing back Annie and Oakley to cause some trouble. After that gets sorted out, Ash and Latias share a quiet moment together where Ash recalls their previous time together, up until the kiss when he pauses and blushes and laughs awkwardly. Latias gets a bit closer, her face a bit red as well, and finally builds up the confidence to kiss him as herself. We cut to the outside of wherever the two are, where Misty and Brock are waiting, and we hear the quiet sound of a Pokeball clicking and Ash saying "Getto daze" under his breath. From then on, Latias is a permanent member of his roster for the rest of the mini-series.

>>52742630
His opinion does matter because he would be familiar with the creation process. He's one of the key founders of the Pokémon series and he's basically right. Look at the video posted, the girl speaks of Pokémon as if she was talking about dogs and the scenes shown in the video show how Pokémon even act like obedient dogs. Why would Gengar wait 3 years for it's owner instead of acting like it states on the dex? Why did it act like an obedient dog rather than the scary monster it's described in the pokedex? The anime even shows Gengar eating dry food like a dog, clearly not a scary monster as in the dex but a creature that's closer to a dog more than anything. The dex can serve as a cool backstory and play a role but depiction takes precedent over it and depicting Pokémon as cute and innocent critters is foremost more important than anything else hence why the Pokémon company is very anal about depiction of Pokemon and very meticulous in the way they're depicted.

And what you mention is common in all media.
https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TalkingAnimal
https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IntellectualAnimal
None of the characters listed stop being animals/pets just because of their abilities, they're still constructed to be pets/animals. Snoopy may be able to write a novel but he's still very much Charlie Brown's dog in the way he's treated and acts. Likewise we know the same with Pokémon because of Tajiri's statements and even statements from The Pokémon Company. This is why Pokémon share universal pet behaviors like zoomies or chewing on shoes like in HGSS or as why the player bathes and cleans them like one does their pet, this implies Pokémon can't clean themselves, or as to why we see things like pet beds in Scarlet and Violet. The games and anime are constructing Pokémon as cats and dogs despite their fantastical nature and we have statements proving it's deliberate.

Things like that play big role in reception to PKMN

>>52744671
I fail to see how it's irrelevant because Pokémon doesn't exist in a vacum. You live in a world where apparently these things dislodge Pokémon from their intended space which they don't. Not only do you chose to ignore actual words from the people who run the series but also the many ways in which the series chooses to contextualize Pokémon. Nothing in Pokémon Snap ending suggest the girl is naive, verily so the point of Pokémon being attuned to the feelings of people and showing trust and love when shown love by people was a major point in Legends of Arceus such as NPCs remarking on the love the MC has for their Pokémon and even the lady at the pasture proclaiming Pokémon must want to be friendly with people since they're not running away from the pastures. Also it's never implied that the gengar bonded with it's trainer, instead it's revealed the trainer started to detest the gengar nevertheless it chose to be a good boy and await for it's owner. Likewise many abandoned Pokémon, like Ash charmender chose to wait for their owner and in Charmander case even if it meant death and enduring more abuse. The reception to the Gengar episode among children was one of sadness, many proclaimed to have cried at it's backstory because it has an element of pet innocence to it, indeed one reddit post called it the jurassic bark of Pokémon.

With all that in mind this construction is very powerful to the point that it greatly influences reception to Pokémon even in the NSFW sphere and as to why so many people have issues with sexualization of any Pokémon, they act cute and innocent and many people perceive Pokémon as occupying the space of critters in universe, and not just any critter but also the space of cats and dogs.

Of course I'm not alone here, as I mentioned you see this perception every on mass media. But as an example a rolling stone article for detective pikachu states that "Pokémon are like dogs" and that the movie is a "dog movie".

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52748590
Call of Legends is at the tail end of low print runs for pokemon cards. Card collecting was losing popularity during neo, and really lost popularity during e-series onward. Reflecting the lower sales, Pokemon lowered their print numbers to reflect lower demand. Low print numbers really start during Neo Destiny, and continued all the way through e-series, ex-series, and gen4 cards. The final set of gen4 was Call of Legends. A special set already, full of semi-reprints (new artwork but same attacks). It wasn't a failure, but it was just released as a small print run during a time when print runs were already tiny. I think Call of Legends may be one of the lowest printed around (along with things like ex doexys and skyridge). As a result, those Shiny Legend cards are among the rarest ultra rares around. If there ever is nostalgia and hype for those cards in the future, their prices could eclipse that of gold stars simply due to their rarity.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52749115
It's fun, sometimes. Playing it casually online or offline with friends is definitely fun, playing against tryhards and coomers is a different story.
You should start playing the solo mode on Master Duel to learn the game, maybe watch some short tutorials on YouTube about all forms of summoning, chaining, important rules of the game, just the basics. Once you get to understand the game mechanics, that's where the fun begins.
If you'd like to build your own deck, you'd be better off starting with 3x structure deck (most SDs have a portion of great cards, meh cards and not so great cards, just keep the best and other useful ones) and throwing in some staples. If you'd like to see if your deck is any good, download EDOpro (Project Ignis) and start fucking around with it, it's totally free and you can play with all cards. That are my 2 cents.
If you don't know how many times you have to put a certain card into your deck, just remember:
>3 times = card you want in your starting hand
>twice = important, but not necessary to start with, or cards you can easily search for
>once = it's a card you can easily search for or isn't that important for your engine
I'm currently playing a Kashtira deck and it's so much fun running that deck, unfortunately Fenrir and Unicorn will most likely become limited next year.
Have fun!

>>52725067
>What is the planned final version
Oh man that's a hard question to answer definitively because I'm making this up as I go. I started writing in July, posted the first playable version in September, and intended to release monthly updates as I add things and fix bugs. The game will be "complete" as of 1.3 in the sense that the story is finished, but I have a ton of secrets and side paths that I want to add, as well as some alternate options for endings. For example right now you can go to Jasmine's computer and find some material to blackmail her with, but I haven't yet added in an option to actually blackmail her or the scenes that would follow that. So I don't really know when the game with be 100% complete.

I've also had a handful of ideas where I had to stop myself and ask if they actually fit in this VN or if they'd be better off for a sequel and/or their own story. I'm not trying to cram every little possible thing into this VN, just the things that fit with the story.

>>52714969
For Enigma you need to surround a plot with 4 random berries, each in a specific direction. You get the hints from the Kanto Berry Master, which can take some time depending on your luck. The mutation chance itself is very low.

Next to Rowap are Kee and Maranga. Their mutation chances are not as low as Enigma, and the setups are simpler, just surround your target plot with a Liechi and a Ganlon (for Kee), or a Salac and a Petaya (for Maranga). I recomend you get those two first, so the berry master can only give you Enigma hints.

Bootstrap is just a bunch of pre-defined css classes, it has documentation about it, this game uses Bootstrap 4
Check https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.0/layout/grid/ to understand a bit

This is farmModal.html, what I did is add a div with the row class and add the col-8, then add another div with class col-4 for the berry data, when you use Bootstrap grid, the 100% of the container is col-12, so you can use col-8 and then another div with col-4 to get two columns taking the 100% of the container, more than 12 will move the column below

In the col-4 div, I added
><!-- ko using: App.game.statistics.selectedBerryID() -->
To get the ID of the selected berry, then I just copypasted the content of the modal-body from the berryDexModal.html file into it
The ko using line grabs the value in App.game.statistics.selectedBerryID() and then you can use said value with $data, the modal also uses $data so you don't need to modify anything from the modal
Here's ko using documentation: https://knockoutjs.com/documentation/with-binding.html

I'm shit explaining stuff so tell me if you didn't understand something
Also, in the link that calls the modal, change the href from href="#berryDexModal" to something else so it doesn't open the modal, after you tested everything, remove anything related to the modal

From what I understand, that's not how enums work, either you use the the dot with the size unit or you use the [] with the index number

>>52738580
Right now I'm leaning towards Dynamax, but I'm not 100% on it yet. Being able to bring weather and terrain control to any battle, as well as being able to pass buffs to Pokemon that wouldn't otherwise be able to get them just by having a balanced team made for really diverse team building. Suddenly Pokemon that were too weak to too frail in old formats could be absolute powerhouses. You could run or counter weather teams with a timely Dynamax. Tera right now mostly seems to boil down to "I have give one of my Pokemon a resistance to its weakness to make it bulky when I need it" or the more rare "I can hit harder and secure a OHKO I otherwise wouldn't."

This thread is for the growth of artists and those who draw for fun. If you're going to give critique, please do it constructively. Rude or blunt critiques won't help anybody.

Requesters are free to request what they wish, but avoid bumping your request every half hour as it's only going to put people off; try giving it a few hours or more.

Please provide references in ONE image, especially when requesting something outside of the Pokémon universe. If you request something from the old Drawthread or a separate thread, COPY & PASTE the actual request instead of posting a link.

Also, be mindful that requests are done at the discretion of the artists, not on a first come first serve basis.

Please remember to save any piece of art you like from these threads, as we may never know when the archive will start deleting images again. Artists can and are recommended to post their works on other outlets for archival purposes.

>>52707993
Nintendo cannot tell you to stop if they have nowhere to deliver the message to. If you want to distribute a file with 100% chance of no one being able to do anything, create a webserver and host it exclusively via Tor or I2P. This will, however, limit who has access to your file because most people don't want to deal with this shit. You can alternatively use anonymous file hosts, uploading to them via a VPN, and reuploading whenever they get a takedown request. If you use several file hosts, you may make it cease to be worth Nintendo's time to keep playing whack a mole.

Finally, file sharing is always an option. Be aware that any time you are hosting a file off of your own PC, you leak your IP address to all of your peers. This is the case both with bittorrent and with IPFS. However, with a sufficient number of peers, it is again very fucking annoying for Nintendo to play whack a mole. They can send you a C&D order, but then everyone else with the same torrent file is capable of seeding. Once a large enough quantity of people have the file, there is nothing they can do to prevent further distribution.

Ultimately, the two keys to being successful at evading copyright law are OPSEC and persistence. Reveal as little as possible about yourself wherever possible. If you must use a name, use a pseudonym that is not in any way connected to your real name. Don't even make it one they can find through three or four hops from a google search because you used it once when you were 8, and that was on an account that you use your current email with. Make something from scratch. Be invisible and relentless.

Happy hacking.

I had an idea for something to put in a romhack and was curious how people feel about it. Here's a quick mockup of UI ideas, but I was wondering how it'd feel to put in something halfway between Pokemon Snap and PLA's research objectives where you take pictures of pokemon doing certain things.

>take a picture of X pokemon
>take a picture of X pokemon getting hit by Y-type attack
>take a picture of X pokemon using a certain attack or type of attack
>take a picture of 2 X pokemon (initiate double battle)
>take a picture of a critical hit
>take a picture of X pokemon with Y status condition
>take a picture of X pokemon in Y weather condition

Stuff like that. The window to check for conditions being completed would probably be the entire turn just so that you don't have to have strict timing on short events or if you have animations turned off. Also put a hard limit on how many pictures you can take per battle and only like one per turn. Might be easier to just make it automatic. I cant' imagine that it'd be TOO hard of a feature to implement, but I am curious if anyone would even want to do it.

I personally like it because I like non-battling progression being in the games. Though you're still technically getting into battles, but you won't need to finish them. Still trying to think of what that progression would look like aside from reporting your pictures through the PC system and getting valuable items like XP candies and such so that you could still be gym ready if you spent your time photographing stuff instead.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52728193
On one hand it's good progression
On the other it's basically a big achievement system, which can be very difficult to balance to make not too grindy yet rewarding. I suppose it depends on scale - if you need to Snap every species doing those things, thats gonna be very grindy and therefore needs a BIG payoff, unless you're trying to make the game more of a collectathon.
Using it for more focused "missions" where the conditions you're trying to achieve are specific and the reward scaled appropriately isn't too bad (think something like the newspaper guy in DPPt that gives you rewards for bringing him pokemon of a specific kind).
I guess it all depends on how pervasive you want this feature to be. Another good use would be allowing the camera to provide information on the pokemon you've photographed - for example, scouting abilities or natures (gives this an excellent use in the wild), or perhaps a little card with types/weaknesses/loose statbars of stats? Could be especially nice if you're attempting to rebalance game stats at all)

posts.name: Anonymous

>>52734096
Yes, DizzyEgg's emerald expansion did this. It's a decomp base that has everything and anything they could think to incorporate RE: raw pokemon data as of gen 8. The issue is most low-level hack makers can't code for shit, and 90% of the available GUI-driven tools are just ways to modify trainers and movepools. Combine these two issues and you get a steady stream of brainlets releasing a "hack" that's just retooling teams, moves, and abilities and MAYBE stats with MAYBE 1-2 new features coded and a couple cute scripts (almost always tied to a trainer NPC). Can't help it, the easiest path yields the common product and the undercurrent to pokemon in general is the "catch em all" ideology that means culling the dex is a sin and EVERYTHING must be present.
It's pretty tone-deaf to be honest - nobody is playing gen 3/4 hacks with the intention of seeing gen 7/8 Pokemon. But some memes like Ludlocke Platinum or Rad Red or Emerald Kaizo get clicks, and brings a fresh wave of people to the scene who just want to make EXACTLY that.
Thankfully there are some based people in the scene who produce code, provide endless useful branches, and are righteous gatekeepers with impossible disdain for these entry-level scrubs who spam posts like "can somebody code me a new weather type :))))"
It's actually super refreshing and I hope it stays as insular as it has, you have to actively try to find where these guys are AND they expect you to keep up but will help if you do the baseline work to understand the game's code.

Thinking of attempting to rebalance BSTs by making the range tighter. As a result will also make Pseudos / mythics / legendaries stand out more, with their BSTs being 575.
S-Tier (think Gyarados) - 520 BST (sucks in pretty much everything that was 510-550)
A-Tier - 500 BST
B-Tier (intended to be average) - 480 BST
C-Tier - 460 BST
D-Tier (reserved for utility or gimmick mons like Smeargle) - 440 BST
This would be BSTs of final evolutions. I think this saves low 400 scrubs like Bug Types and brings in line the 520+ gods so they aren't so despondently strong. Looking at the current roster, this doesn't seem like a crazy change, it mostly shifts Pokemon around by like 10-20 points max, but allows me to massage numbers to a set goal to help with balancing.
Am I retarded with this? Just trying my hand at stat adjustment but I don't want to be that dipshit that adds 50 ATT to Swallow as a "minor buff, teehee!"

>>52742329
>adding Gen 4+ mons to a Gen 3 game in more limited numbers, like with cross-gen evos or regional forms?

In my personal hack I decided against this, because I wanted to stick to the original 151.

What I did instead is, for Pokemon that received a cross-gen evo, I gave their stats to the Pokemon next level down. So there's no Electivire or Magmortar, but Electabuzz and Magmar have gotten upgraded. In some cases I did further tweaks - Golbat now has Crobat's stats, but Zubat doesn't evolve until Level 36. Seadra has Kingdra's stats but not the typing - however, holding the Dragon Scale doubles the strength of its Dragon attacks. And Onix has Steelix's stats while being pure Rock - but with a special ability granting it immunity to Electric-type attacks (ala Levitate).

In general I chose to buff the original 151 rather than just piling more Pokemon in. The big thing was reducing Psychic's stranglehold on the game - 1/3 of the roster is weak to Psychic, thanks to how much Poison there is, and only the few Bugs without Poison are actual counters to Psychics. So I did a bunch of type tweaks:

- Bulbasaur/Ivysaur are now pure Grass (Venusaur is still Grass/Poison)
- Ekans/Arbok are now Poison/Dark
- Zubat/Golbat are now Dark/Flying
- Oddish/Gloom/Vileplume are now Grass/Dark
- Gastly/Gengar/Haunter are pure Ghost
- Drowsee/Hypno are now Psychic/Dark

These changes drop that 1/3 to 1/5, while also increasing the Dark population (at 9/151 it's still a little below average). Butterfree, Beedrill and Parasect also have held items to boost certain stats (ala Light Ball/Thick Club) - Silver Powder doubles Butterfree's Special Attack and Speed, Poison Barb doubles Beedrill's Attack and Speed, and Tiny Mushroom boosts Parasect's Defense and Special Defense by 50% while Big Mushroom boosts them by 100%

>>52716272
>Will chesnaught at least be good in pvp?
Probably. It has Venusaur stats for the most part, with fighting-type instead of poison-type, Smack Down instead of Razor Leaf, and Superpower instead of Sludge Bomb. The lack of poison-typing and Razor Leaf might make it feel like less of a threat against things it counters, and its fighting-typing will make it more susceptible to Charmers and Wing Attackers, but the ability to constantly threaten either Frenzy Plant or Superpower will definitely give it some place in the GL and UL meta.

posts.com:
>>52724671
>GL
Wing Attack is now flying-type Vine Whip, so Mantine has been wrecking some havoc, but the main players in that category right now are Pelipper, Gliscor and Pidgeot. Obstagoon, Galvantula and Galarian Stunfisk are still decent, though the rest haven't really seen play outside remix or cups.
>UL
Dragonite finally got Superpower (as a normal move), so it's been very power since that addition. Escavalier, Metagross, Alolan Muk and Gyarados are still pretty good. Should also be noted that Dragon Tail is now about as strong as Dragon Breath, with slightly better DPT in exchange for longer animations.
>ML
After MLPC in early January, there will be no more classic cups, so most players will be running lvl. 41+ Pokémon, so keep that in mind before jumping in with what you have. Dragonite is even better in this league with Superpower, Excadrill has become the dedicated low-tier fairy, dragon and steel killer, and Groudon basically needs Fire Punch to do more than charge up charge moves.

Overall meta has changed a lot, though most of the old top-tiers are still usable, if not exactly good enough to get you to legend rank.

The craziest thing is that Ursaluna, Staraptor and Alolan Golem are decent Pokémon, the problem is that their Community Day moves/movesets were either mostly a downgrade or complete shit.

Also doesn't help giving that "unique" move to Mamoswine, completely invalidating Ursaluna's existence.

It's almost like they wanted to get people excited for Community Days again without giving them anything of value, as if they still wanted the pandemic SotG while trying to pretend that, NOW, things are not just filler.

This is big because hoarders will have leftover legendaries from 2017 like Lugia, Ho-oh, Groudon, whatever had been available at that time.

>>52742756
As you just explained, there are really only a handful of Tera types that are "best practice". So when you prepare for Tera, you can make predictions based on what their expected Tera is, you can often just tell in team preview what it might be. If someone is using an off-meta teratype, then it is likely sub-optimal and the user will have fewer opportunities to actually use that tera than they would have had they just chosen Tera Ground or Tera Grass. So in the vast majority of situations, you can get a read on the opponent's tera, and in rare situations where you get blindsided (just like how you might get blindsided by an unusual set), your opponent is usually putting themselves in a poor position. If they're using an off-meta teratype and have a set to make it work that you haven't seen, that's a credit to them.

Also it's been barely a month since showdown OU and even less since the format settled after initial quickbans. It's objectively early meta right now.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52742904
Off-meta sets don't change your entire type, though. You might get hit be an unexpected weak move, but that won't be as impactful as changing your entire type, weaknesses and all. Most Pokemon have a laundry list of viable Tera-types, with only a small handful having only 1 type that stands head and shoulders above the rest. If you send out a Pokemon expecting to wall Espathra, it could be any of 5 prominent types, with many others that are less viable but will shift to be more viable as people start catching onto the trendy types. People will start expecting Water Espathra and switch in their Electric types only to be met with Ground Espathra. Then Ground Espathra will be the flavor of the month and people will switch to Ice Espathra. Then Ice Espathra will be the flavor of the month and people will switch to Electric Espathra, and so on.

Tera is not healthy for singles. It's fine in doubles where you can just focus a Pokemon down with strong STAB moves and hope you covered the correct Tera type, but in singles you have less moves you can make before a Pokemon gets out of control.

Like the 20 speed EVs on Sylveon (to outspeed Hydreigon under Tailwind?) but curious why you'd invest in Sp. Def instead of HP. Gives comparable survivability from special attacks while bolstering your physical bulk too.

>>52749590
I mean, I'm having fun. Playing on cart is definitely more fun for me, and you see better players at the top, like known tournament players. I've played against Edu, Cybertron and Viz all at some point between SV and SwSh Master Ball. Around top 500 the games were the toughest I've ever played.

I tested this team on showdown up to about 1500 before I stopped. Then for a few days I shiny hunted for Murkrow, Hariyama, and Azumarril and built my team. I went 24-8, until tonight when I played some really good players running unconventional teams.

The only difficult thing about team building on cart right now is Tera Shards. Everything else takes very little time unless you're an autist like me and you want to shiny hunt your favorites one afternoon.There's a trick to turn off auto-save and use your shards and items and save the team as a rental for yourself though. And there's a big Delibird event coming up that apparently will give a lot of shards. Otherwise, you don't need to breed at all, you don't even have to EV train. Feathers, bottle caps, mints, and vitamins are abundant.

>>52730998
This is correct. The reason you can set an egg move on a pokemon that was wild caught is because there exists a process in game for the pokemon to get that move normally (through the mirror herb) so egg moves on wild pokemon are no longer an issue.

The latest handler is like that for you because you don't have your own save file loaded into pkhex so because you changed the TID/SID/OT from the pkhex default when you load it pkhex uses the current user (since you dont have a save loaded that is pkhex) as the last user because it does not match the currently set TID/SID/OT

>>52749268
Not so much that. Aside from obvious reasons, like an anthro form being quite pleasant to hug and whisper nice things to as you sleep, my aversion to the human form is moreso because the sight of it, and the touch, especially, reminds me of the bodies I see on the job.
And the resultant negative emotions of grief, repulsion and loss.
A good amount of the problem is emotional, see. Blood and guts is blood and guts, I worked in my grandpa's butcher shop part time and figured that out, but death is decidedly more... human.
Especially if its some teenager. You hear so much about their future. How kind and lovely and smart they were. But then they decided they were sober enough to drive home when they shouldn't have, or they misjudged the speed of a turn or how far away a tree was. Even something so innocent as forgetting their seatbelt.
Then? Well, they're oh so much flesh that bounced off the tarmac, just getting pecked at by crows. Every last lick of uniqueness and humanity, their soul if you wanna go there, well, its gone, split to the wind. One might even go so far as to wonder if it was ever there in the first place, if the human mind and sentience is but a trick of oh so many carbon atoms and chemical energy put in a funny shape, and entirely ceases to be when those randomly arranged bits and bobs come apart.
But you don't need, or want, to hear about my personal thoughts. I'll tell you a funny story instead, because thats what imageboards are for. That and posting cute pokemon pictures.
Once had an ex, right. One of those chicks whose super into true crime podcasts and serial killer documentaries, that sort of thing.
Well, fella, there's a reason she's my ex. She thought it was hot that I thought of dead people when I saw her naked. Ain't that just nutty, huh?
Anyways, drive responsibly, all. There's likely someone out there who cares a good deal for you.

>>52740950
The color scheme does a lot of heavy lifting here. Red and blue are complimentary colors but don't actually work well on characters unless some clever blending is used. So her leggings fade from red to blue, the red matching her hair and eyes and the blue matching her sweater. The sweater has some brighter blues around the color and hood.

She's very curvy, which is mentioned a lot, but this is further highlighted by her sweater ending just about where a miniskirt would, revealing most of her figure while also keeping her warm, making it practical.

Her hair is short and simple, but very bright. The sweater is considerably darker than rest of her which allows her face and of course her thighs, to stand out considerably more than they already do. Her hair being short draws you to her eyes almost immediately which are just piercingly red, and erotically shaped. Red is a color of intense passion.

You are made to notice everything that pertains to sexual stimulation as fast as possible, because her designer is extremely perverted.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>52703814
Sydney gets some boost with Sp Att this week, so someone who can reliably debuff that would be good. Also applies team wide paralysis before sync which fucks your regen. As a budget team I would try:
3* Marley Arcanine gives speed boost and can protect/cure the paralysis
Ghettsis with Glaciate spam can usually slow cheese one fight paired with a tank and some combination of speed booster, poisoner, sp def debuffer, or healer.
4* Viola Masquerain reduces the full team's Sp Att and can play special tank.

If you don't have the units for that, you might be able to experiment with 3* Janine Ariados which can poison and then debuff Sp Att and Speed every turn, or 3* Surge Electrode which can reduce Sp Att by 2 every turn.

>>52723997
If you’re putting money in this game, than getting the 20 day login packs are definitely the deal, as well as the $1 gem pack that always happens whenever we get a new Masterfair (although right now they’re gone since it’s already been like a month since Cale, and Serena were added), New Years will also have a good bundle, $8 and you get 2022 or 2023 gems.
You only really want to use paid gems on selector multis, or on a step up for a new seasonal pair that you seriously like, want, and where you really don’t have any f2p gems for them (I definitely do not recommend doing every step at all), also save paid gems for the 25 of every month so you can do the 25 gem multi. Single pulls are also good to go if it’s a with increased rates like a fair banner, and then using f2p gems to do multis a few days before it ends if you didn’t get the featured you wanted.

If you powered up Ghetsis during the Unova VA, he does fine numbers as an Ice DPS, you just need units to buff him regardless of their types. Ice has always been lacking, mainly because most of them are limited to fair and season exclusive. Same with fairy, especially fairy.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>52744844
To the newbie anon asking about choice specs vs shell bell items last thread:
https://unite-db.com/items
Consider checking out unite.db. They give out detailed descriptions on items and level stats in game.
Choices specs is good for any attacker who uses the special attack stat. (don't worry about the multi-hitting thing.) It's basically extra damage against one target every 8 second.
https://unite-db.com/stats
As for cooldown reduction, some mons actually get bonus CDR when they reach lvl 9. These usually range between 10-20%. The blue jungle buff also gives you 10% CDR for 70 sec.
In addition, the bonus 4.5 % CDR from shell bell, energy amp (also 4.5% CDR) and/or Emblems (Black bonus, 1-4%) also stack with these bonuses.
Combines all of these together and you usually get a bonus CDR of 20-30%, enough to shave off 1-2 seconds your move cooldowns depending on which mons you use.
Apologies for not giving out advice for specific mon, but I hope you use these tools to figure out the answer that you're looking for.

>>52717604
well to be honest it makes sense, if you look at it from a business perspective. By announcing that
>1) Ash is retiring
>2) Ash becomes a pokemon master
>3) Misty and Brock are returning
>4) A new series with Ash not as the protagonist
Then it leads to a lot of buzz and interest in something that might have been ignored otherwise, as the worse thing for something is to not be talked about and fade into obscurity. Think of it like cashing in your chips for a big payout. As you now have a lot of potential older customers who may not have been keeping up with the series now becoming interested again.

Marketing move, clearly, both for the 30-somethings that watched them as kids and everyone else who knows how central RGBY iconography is to the brand. The anime kind of cheats here. While its continuity is so light and Ash's character so often tweaked to fit the moment that it would be better described as "relaunching" every 3 years, the connective tissue is technically there, and all kinds of shows that don't dramatically acknowledge the passage of time can still call back to earlier characters or events as part of the ending. And if nothing else Ash has only seen Misty for few days time in what amounts to... six years of in-anime time? That's reason enough. The Ash of the ending is not the Ash that Pokemania children watched, no... but then he was never going to be.

It's easy enough to explain why. A selected Pokemon only lasts 24 hours. Any longer would be outrageous. And outside of a very small handful of instances, the threads never persist to the bump limit. If you want to find older threads, you can use the /vp/ archives such as the one you've linked. The threads have consistent enough text in the OP and subject that it's very easy to search. Hell, just search OP's trip and you'll find everything very easily.

"Should of" isn't the kind of error that you'd expect from ESLs, but from native speakers. ESLs have a second language to rely upon, so a "should" not followed by a verb will feel off; and they don't spell things based on how they sound like, so they won't confuse "'ve" with "of".
It's the same deal with it's/its, they're/their, than/then. Those are mistakes coming from the corn picking niggers, not the "then who was phone?" crowd.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52743000
>What? That's actually a somewhat common mistake with ESL's because that's precisely how many languages(not English obviously) work.
ESLs might allow the spelling of their native languages interfere into English, like writing "this is voring" (ES) or "this is baring" (RU). However, they'll rely considerably less on how the words sound in English than a native English speaker would.
That's because you learn to speak your L1 years before you learn to write it, but when it comes to L2+ you'll probably learn to write it before/while learning to speak it. You're "wiring" your brain towards the language in a different way, you memorise the spelling by itself, not by the sound.

And specifically in the case of "should have": it's harder to confuse have/of if your native language distinguishes them. Like ES tener/de, RU imet'/[insert genitive], etc.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I'll settle this argument.
Egg Power 2 is definitely worth it, I haven't done the exact math but with Egg Power 2 I was able to do multiple more rounds of Eggs in 30 minutes.

Pretty much all of the Go-For-Broke Grilles have the Egg Power sandwich. Alfornada is the easiest, it's $2,800 and it's along a stretch of road you can use for egg hatching anyways. In general, Alfornada is the easiest place to breed and hatch on autopilot.

Making sandwiches yourself is cheaper but it takes significantly more time navigating the menu, doing the minigame and seeing the longer cutscene. For 5 hours of breeding, you'll spend $28,000 buying meals. That's not nothing, but ultimately I find the price tag worth the convenience.

>>52749464
It's truly not that bad when you consider the scope of things.
Let's say you have a breeding project that will take you a whole free Saturday, 10 hours. You will spend $56k Pokedollars for that entire day's worth of breeding. That's the price of 5 and a half Proteins, or a couple Big Nugget or Big Pearl drops from raids. However the time you save by just buying the meals means you WILL hatch more eggs per minute, objectively. With that additional time, you could probably spend those minutes doing raids and earn your money back anyways.

so, it's definitely worth it. If you're penny pinching though I get it, you do you.

>>52717546
Starmie is really nasty, it has a +22.5% crit rate with Bubblebeam for an effective power of 65*1.5*1.8= 175bp off of 100 Special.

In RBY criticals don't do double damage, rather it's level dependent multiplier of (2*Lv+5)/(Lv+5). That means a Level 2 Rattata on Route 1 getting a critical only hits for 1.28 times damage.
I actually kind of like that, it makes the early game much less volatile, no one hit kills on an unlucky critical. And it's not like it affect competitive much since at 50 the multiplier is 1.9 and at 100 it's 1.95.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Hey friends, I've been wanting to relive the days when I actually enjoyed this fucking series, so I figured I'd do a Nuzlocke challenge like the good old days. Gonna play the era I enjoy, GBA/DS. Sort of a region-travel playthrough. FireRed, SoulSilver, Emerald, Platinum, and White.

Rules aside from the normal:
>Champion Clause: Any Pokemon, living or dead, that makes it to the HoF in one game has its line stricken from all subsequent ones. This includes split evos like Eevees or Hitmons.
>Set battle style
>Wild Pokemon and Starters randomized to within the same power level to make catches actually somewhat interesting in regions with poorly-distributed Regional Dexes

Starting off with a choice of Totodile, Pichu, or Ralts with Brock as my first gym leader makes things easy, though it does unfortunately give Boomer's rival, Zoomer, what he called "an easy dub no cap fr fr" with a two-shot Thundershock. Thankfully, I don't consider the Nuzlocke to start until after Rival 1, so here we go!

>>52747724
>A floating timeline (also known as a sliding timescale) is a device used in fiction, particularly in long-running serials in comics and animation as well as other media, to explain why characters age little or not at all over a period of time—despite real-world markers like notable events, people and technology appearing in the works and correlating with the real world. The term "floating timeline" is used in the comics community to refer to series that take place in a "continuous present". This timeline is due to the fact that the authors have no need to accommodate the aging of their characters, which is also typical of most animated television shows. It is used as a plot device to "explain or explain away inconsistencies in the way that events and characters exist within a world"
Hmm
>The creators have stated for Satoshi/Ash that he and the others in a perpetual early summer, effectively a continuous present.
>There are many notable markers such as Lapras being gone away for a year, the number of months before each region's conference, Professor Burnet having a baby, Ash planning and giving Pikachu a surprise anniversary to celebrate their 1-year anniversary, or even the simple day and night cycle to indicate the passage of time. In addition the world gains new technology such as Rotom phones as a sign of breakthroughs being made that were otherwise not present. In addition for technology, the TVs that various characters use reflect more of our current time period than what was initially shown.
>Despite the markers, Ash and the other characters never age.
As if we actually factored in the various markers, Ash would be easily 15 years old at minimum.
